flawed_nl_solution:
The third dig site was dated from the year 8400 / 2 = <<8400/2=42000>>42000 BC.
Thus, the first dig site was dated from the year 42000 - 3700 = <<42000-3700=38300>>38300 BC.
The second dig site was 352 years older, so it was dated from the year 38300 + 352 = <<38300+352=38652>>38652 BC.
#### 38652

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 4200, not 42000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
